Text: Reminder Maxwell Museum Members Saleforget Tomorrow Wed Dec th from is the MAXWELL MUSEUM ASSOCIATION MEMBERS ONLY SALE There will be refreshments door prizes and special tours of the Maxwells Collections If youve never been down there this is a real treat as well as OFF ALL ITEMS EXCEPT BOOKS So if you are looking for special gifts for special people this is the place to be The UNM Parking Services has agreed not to ticket in the C lot north of the Museum and the B lot south of the Museum as well as the Maxwells lot adjacent to the Museum on the west Come on in and share in a little holiday festivity

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Saturday October AM PM CELEBRATE AUTUMN A DIFFERENT KIND OF HARVEST FESTIVAL Come Celebrate Autumn at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Saturday October ampm FREE The Alfonso Ortiz Center for Intercultural Studies and the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology invite all to a celebration of the fall harvest Please join us for food music games arts crafts fun and much more Hear the music of Rondalla de Albuquerque playing selections from New Mexico and around the world Meet New Mexican artists Watch Diego Lopez create retablo paintings Create your own tin work Do your holiday shopping at the festival and support the artisans of New Mexico Fresh fall vegetables will also be available for purchase directly from local growers Discuss land and water issues in New Mexico Learn about organic agriculture heirloom seeds wildlife habitat and more A round table forum at pm will bring experts together to discuss our land and water resources Enjoy green chile stew roasted corn fresh bread baked in the Maxwell horno and lots of other foods See a working apple press and taste the fresh cider Decorate a pumpkin or play a game of horseshoes Learn to rope a hay bale Bring your family and friends to celebrate the season Free entrance and lots of free parking parking is open on weekends For more information call Sponsored by the New Mexico Endowment for the Humanities Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at intlasp

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this weekend at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Saturday October PM FREE MONTHLY ARTS AND CRAFTS DEMONSTRATION Hispanic Tinwork with Ted Arellanes of GT Stained Glass and Tinworks will demonstrate and discuss techniques of early New Mexican tinworking while assembling a mirror Mr Arellanes is an award winning artisan who has created commissioned furnishings for the La Fonda Hotel the UNM Zimmerman library the Hispanic Cultural Center and has recieved commisions fromas far away as Japan New York

Maxwell Museum UpdateFirst apologies for placing addresses in wrong address box last time so you all got a vast list of names to wade through Coming up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Thursday March PM FREE LIGHT UPON LIGHT MUSLIM PERSPECTIVES Series will present documentary films by and about Muslim women Tajik Woman by Mehrnaz SaeedVafa min and Dont Ask Why by Sabiha Sumar min Will include PointCounterpoint discussion and comments by women of the local Muslim community Refreshments will be served Sponsored by the Alfonso Ortiz Center for Intercultural Studies Anthro Lecture Hall Saturday March AM PM FREE MONTHLY ARTS CRAFTS FROM AROUND THE WORLD DEMO Artist Elzbieta Kalenta will demonstrate the fascinating art of Polish papercutting and egg decoration just in time for Easter Sponsored by the City of Albuquerques Urban Enhancement Trust Fund

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Wednesday Feb Noon FREE DINE NAVAJO BLESSINGWAY STORIES Told by Sunny Dooley The social versions of sacred chants these stories told only in the winter months present the world view of the Dine people and detail their relationship with their surroundings Bring a brown bag lunch and enjoy Supported by the National Endowment for the Humanities Maxwell Museum North Gallery For more information call Saturday Feb FREE MONTHLY ARTS AND CRAFTS DEMONSTRATION Join us as the Zevk Ensemble presents a wonderful varied program of music art and storytelling from the cultures of the Near East Music with traditional instruments and storytelling from AM PM art program with activity by Rahmah Lutz PM then more music If you can color with a magic marker you can make something beautiful More music to finish up with Fascinating event for all ages Supported by the City of Albuquerques Urban Enhancement Trust Fund Museum Store will offer a off sale MMA Members on everything except books For more information call

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up next week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropolgy Tuesday February AM PM INDIAN BREAD BAKING DEMONSTRATION AND SALE Mary Jane Edaakie The Bread Lady will be here baking her bread in the Maxwells own horno and serving Indian tacos fry bread pastries and cookies so please join us for lunch and take home a loaf Call for more information Thursday February th AM PM SPECIAL VALENTINES DAY MUSEUM STORE SALE For Maxwell Museum Association Members only The Maxwell Museum is offering a special off except books popup sale in the Museum store If you are not a member this is the perfect time to become one and join in Memberships help support museum programs and there is a membership level for every budget Call for more information on memberships or visit our website at wwwunmedumaxwell

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing Up This Week At the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Tuesday February PM ETHNIC LUNCH Enjoy Italian cuisine prepared by Nanas Italian Ristorante and Pizzeria Menu Meat Lasagna Layers of pasta mozzarella and ricotta cheese topped with homemade Italian meat sauce Includes salad and homemade bread Tortellini Primavera cheese tortellini with Alfredo sauce tossed with a vegetable medley of broccoli cauliflower and carrots Includes salad and homemade bread Beverages Iced tea or lemonade

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Thursday January PM EXPLORE AFGHANISTAN Learn about the landscape history people and ethnicities of Afghanistan with former BBC journalist and translator Mr Ahmad Shafi Originally this program was to present Mr Abdullah Ayazi The Map Man but he had to cancel and sends his apologies Mr Shafi is his colleague and copresenter and is perhaps even better qualified to speak about the current situation as well as the history He began working for the BBC at age translating escorting correspondents to the front lines and arranging interviews with government officials He became a journalist in his own right and has also worked with Healthnet International on refugee issues Maxwell Museum North Gallery Refreshments will be served Mr Ayazis maps will be available

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing Up This Week At The Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Wednesday January PM INDIAN BREAD BAKING DEMONSTRATION AND SALE Mary Jane is back Watch her bake bread buy some to take home and enjoy her Indian tacos fry bread and pastries here at the museum Thursday January PM MMA PEOPLE OF THE SOUTHWEST LECTURE Dr Kurt Anschuetz will present The Past is Not a Pickle Living History and the Use of Heritage Resources in sustaining New Mexico Community Traditions examining how contemporary Pueblo People interact with archaeological resources and their concerns about how strict preservation threatens to bring the death of history Sponsored by the Modrall Law Firm Saturday January FREE MONTHLY ARTS CRAFTS DEMONSTRATION Origami the fascinating and intricate art of Japanese paperfolding will be demonstrated by Sato Shankles Bring the kids and make it a Family Day

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up next week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology ETHNIC LUNCH PM Perfect for after the Holidays the January ethnic lunch will be Vietnamese Cuisine prepared by Huong Thao Vietnamese Restaurant Menu Steamed Rice will Grilled Lemon Grass Chicken Includes Eggroll and Side of Steamed Vegetables Steamed Rice with Spicy Stirfry Lemon Grass Tofu Includes Vegetarian Eggroll and Side of Steamed Vegetables Rice Noodles with Spicy Stirfry Chicken Curry Rice Noodles with Spicy Stirfry Curried Tofu Beverages Soy Milk or Soda

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Tuesday March PM ETHNIC LUNCH Enjoy Israeli Cuisine prepared by Sharon Levin Gourmet To Go Menu Spinach Boreka Spinach in Phyllo Dough served with Roasted Red Pepper Hummus Tabouli and Pita Bread Marinated Roasted Chicken served with Roasted Red Pepper Hummus Tabouli and Pita Bread Dessert Jewish Cookies Mandelbrot Ruglach or Brownies Beverages Thursday March INDIAN BREAD BAKING DEMONSTRATION AND SALE Mary Jane Edaakie will be baking and selling her horno bread and serving those great Indian tacos fry bread pastries and cookies
Update OopsOops DateDate error on the Update Beverly Singers talk at the Zimmerman Library is Tuesday February and the Bread Lady is Wednesday February th Sorry
Update AddendumSorry forgot the date of the Ethnic Lunchits Tuesday January

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthopology Saturday February PM FREE MONTHLY ARTS CRAFTS FROM AROUND THE WORLD Join us as the Zevk Ensemble presents a wonderful varied program of music storytelling and art from the Near East Music and storytelling with fascinating Near Eastern instruments begins at Art program with activity begins at PM then more music Fun for all age groups Call for more information Tuesday February th PM Zimmerman Library FREE Wiping the War Paint Off the Lens by author Beverly Singer Director of the Alfonso Ortiz Center for Intercultural Studies is the subject of the next lecture in the Open Doors Regional Scholars and Writers Series at the University of New Mexico For more information please call Thursday February PM PM INDIAN BREAD BAKING DEMONSTRATION AND SALE Mary Jane The Bread Lady Edaakie will be visiting us again baking fresh bread in the Maxwells Horno and serving up her delicious Indian Tacos fry bread and pastries

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing Up This Week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Wednesday March PM INDIAN BREAD BAKING DEMONSTRATION AND SALE Fresh bread baked in the Maxwells horno Indian tacos fry bread and pastries Maxwell Museum Store will offer a off sale MMA members on everything except books Join us

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Wednesday Nov PM FREE CHATAUQUA PERFORMANCE Spend an evening of living breathing history when Dr Noel Pugach becomes one of New Mexicos most memorable historical figures LEW WALLACE author of BEN HUR New Mexico territorial govenor Civil War General US minister to the ottoman Empire and gun runner Supported by the New Mexico Endowment for the Humanities Thursday Nov PM Horno Bread Baking Demonstration and Sale This is Mary JaneThe Bread Lady Edaakies last appearance at the Maxwell for the year so dont miss her fresh made horno bread Indian tacos fry bread and pastries

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this week at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Tuesday Dec th AM PM ETHNIC LUNCH Back by popular demand India Kitchen will prepare Northern Indian cuisine Chicken Curry Vegetarian Spinach Saga spinach gram beans tomatoes onion garlic curry Combo Plate both All entrees include rice and papadum crispy high protein bean flour wafers and are served with hot sauce pickles and tamarind chutney Drinks Mango Lussi yogurt drink or Hot Chai Tuesday Dec th PM FREE DISCOVERING ISLAM THE AMERICAN EXPERIENCE Individuals from traditional Western cultural backgrounds share their experiences of personal transformation and discovery of Islamic traditions Second in the Muslim Perspectives series Maxwell Museum North Gallery Wednesday Dec th PM FREE st ANNUAL PATSY TONY ROMO AWARD LECTURE Presented to an outstanding doctoral candidate in the Department of Anthropology Michael Schillaci will speak on Hybrids and Hominids Using Primate Hybridization to Investigate Neanderthal Taxonomy Reception with refreshments follows Maxwell Museum North Gallery Thursday Dec th PM MMA MEMBERS ONLY HOLIDAY EVENT SALE Come mix mingle and enjoy refreshments while taking advantage of a special off except books sale in the Museum Store For MMA Members only

Maxwell Museum UpdateComing up this weekend at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Saturday Dec th PM FREE MONTHLY ARTS AND CRAFTS DEMONSTRATION Calligraphy Demonstration Petrita Alcon and Lori Festa of the Escribiente Calligraphy Society will demonstrate and help you try your hand at this beautiful and timehonored art form The Maxwell Museum Store will also offer a special holiday sale of off all items except books Arts Crafts Demonstrations are sponsored by the City of Albuquerques Urban Enhancement Trust Fund

MAXWELL OOPSOOPS Sorrywrong address slot The message in a readable form is Coming up this weekend at the Maxwell Museum of Anthropology Saturday Dec th PM FREE MONTHLY ARTS AND CRAFTS DEMONSTRATION Calligraphy Demonstration Petrita Alcon and Lori Festa of the Escribiente Calligraphy Society will demonstrate and help you try your hand at this beautiful and timehonored art form The Maxwell Museum Store will also offer a special holiday sale of off all items except books Arts Crafts Demonstrations are sponsored by the City of Albuquerques Urban Enhancement Trust Fund
